00048 /* Motion Paths ------------------------------------ */
00049 /* (used for Pose Channels and Objects) */
00050 
00051 /* Data point for motion path (mpv) */
00052 typedef struct bMotionPathVert {
00053     float co[3];                /* coordinates of point in 3D-space */
00054     int flag;                   /* quick settings */
00055 } bMotionPathVert;
00056 
00057 /* bMotionPathVert->flag */
00058 typedef enum eMotionPathVert_Flag {
00059         /* vert is selected */
00060     MOTIONPATH_VERT_SEL     = (1<<0)
00061 } eMotionPathVert_Flag;
00062 
00063 /* ........ */
00064 
00065 /* Motion Path data cache (mpath)
00066  *  - for elements providing transforms (i.e. Objects or PoseChannels) 
00067  */
00068 typedef struct bMotionPath {
00069     bMotionPathVert *points;    /* path samples */
00070     int length;                 /* the number of cached verts */
00071     
00072     int start_frame;            /* for drawing paths, the start frame number */
00073     int end_frame;              /* for drawing paths, the end frame number */
00074     
00075     int flag;                   /* baking settings - eMotionPath_Flag */ 
00076 } bMotionPath;
00077 
00078 /* bMotionPath->flag */
00079 typedef enum eMotionPath_Flag {
00080         /* (for bones) path represents the head of the bone */
00081     MOTIONPATH_FLAG_BHEAD       = (1<<0),
00082         /* motion path is being edited */
00083     MOTIONPATH_FLAG_EDIT        = (1<<1)
00084 } eMotionPath_Flag;
00085 
00086 /* Visualisation General --------------------------- */
00087 /* for Objects or Poses (but NOT PoseChannels) */
00088 
00089 /* Animation Visualisation Settings (avs) */
00090 typedef struct bAnimVizSettings {
00091     /* Onion-Skinning Settings ----------------- */
00092     int ghost_sf, ghost_ef;         /* start and end frames of ghost-drawing range (only used for GHOST_TYPE_RANGE) */
00093     int ghost_bc, ghost_ac;         /* number of frames before/after current frame to show */
00094     
00095     short ghost_type;               /* eOnionSkin_Types */
00096     short ghost_step;               /* number of frames between each ghost shown (not for GHOST_TYPE_KEYS) */
00097     
00098     short ghost_flag;               /* eOnionSkin_Flag */
00099     
00100     /* General Settings ------------------------ */
00101     short recalc;                   /* eAnimViz_RecalcFlags */
00102     
00103     /* Motion Path Settings ------------------- */
00104     short path_type;                /* eMotionPath_Types */
00105     short path_step;                /* number of frames between points indicated on the paths */
00106     
00107     short path_viewflag;            /* eMotionPaths_ViewFlag */
00108     short path_bakeflag;            /* eMotionPaths_BakeFlag */
00109     
00110     int path_sf, path_ef;           /* start and end frames of path-calculation range */
00111     int path_bc, path_ac;           /* number of frames before/after current frame to show */
00112 } bAnimVizSettings;
00113 
00114 
00115 /* bAnimVizSettings->recalc */
00116 typedef enum eAnimViz_RecalcFlags {
00117         /* motionpaths need recalculating */
00118     ANIMVIZ_RECALC_PATHS    = (1<<0)
00119 } eAnimViz_RecalcFlags;
00120 
00121 
00122 /* bAnimVizSettings->ghost_type */
00123 typedef enum eOnionSkin_Types {
00124         /* no ghosts at all */
00125     GHOST_TYPE_NONE = 0,
00126         /* around current frame */
00127     GHOST_TYPE_ACFRA,
00128         /* show ghosts within the specified frame range */
00129     GHOST_TYPE_RANGE,
00130         /* show ghosts on keyframes within the specified range only */
00131     GHOST_TYPE_KEYS
00132 } eOnionSkin_Types;
00133 
00134 /* bAnimVizSettings->ghost_flag */
00135 typedef enum eOnionSkin_Flag {
00136         /* only show selected bones in ghosts */
00137     GHOST_FLAG_ONLYSEL  = (1<<0)
00138 } eOnionSkin_Flag;
00139 
00140 
00141 /* bAnimVizSettings->path_type */
00142 typedef enum eMotionPaths_Types {
00143         /* show the paths along their entire ranges */
00144     MOTIONPATH_TYPE_RANGE = 0,
00145         /* only show the parts of the paths around the current frame */
00146     MOTIONPATH_TYPE_ACFRA
00147 } eMotionPath_Types;
00148 
00149 /* bAnimVizSettings->path_viewflag */
00150 typedef enum eMotionPaths_ViewFlag {
00151         /* show frames on path */
00152     MOTIONPATH_VIEW_FNUMS       = (1<<0),
00153         /* show keyframes on path */
00154     MOTIONPATH_VIEW_KFRAS       = (1<<1),
00155         /* show keyframe/frame numbers */
00156     MOTIONPATH_VIEW_KFNOS       = (1<<2),
00157         /* find keyframes in whole action (instead of just in matching group name) */
00158     MOTIONPATH_VIEW_KFACT       = (1<<3)
00159 } eMotionPath_ViewFlag;
00160 
00161 /* bAnimVizSettings->path_bakeflag */
00162 typedef enum eMotionPaths_BakeFlag {
00163         /* motion paths directly associated with this block of settings needs updating */
00164     MOTIONPATH_BAKE_NEEDS_RECALC    = (1<<0),
00165         /* for bones - calculate head-points for curves instead of tips */
00166     MOTIONPATH_BAKE_HEADS           = (1<<1),
00167         /* motion paths exist for AnimVizSettings instance - set when calc for first time, and unset when clearing */
00168     MOTIONPATH_BAKE_HAS_PATHS       = (1<<2)
00169 } eMotionPath_BakeFlag;

00174 /* PoseChannel ------------------------------------ */
00175 
00176 /* PoseChannel 
00177  *
00178  * A PoseChannel stores the results of Actions and transform information 
00179  * with respect to the restposition of Armature bones 
00180  */
00181 typedef struct bPoseChannel {
00182     struct bPoseChannel *next, *prev;
00183     
00184     IDProperty          *prop;      /* User-Defined Properties on this PoseChannel */           
00185     
00186     ListBase            constraints;/* Constraints that act on this PoseChannel */
00187     char                name[64];   /* need to match bone name length: MAXBONENAME */
00188     
00189     short               flag;       /* dynamic, for detecting transform changes */
00190     short               ikflag;     /* settings for IK bones */
00191     short               protectflag; /* protect channels from being transformed */
00192     short               agrp_index; /* index of action-group this bone belongs to (0 = default/no group) */
00193     char                constflag;  /* for quick detecting which constraints affect this channel */
00194     char                selectflag; /* copy of bone flag, so you can work with library armatures, not for runtime use */
00195     char                pad0[6];
00196 
00197     struct Bone         *bone;      /* set on read file or rebuild pose */
00198     struct bPoseChannel *parent;    /* set on read file or rebuild pose */
00199     struct bPoseChannel *child;     /* set on read file or rebuild pose, the 'ik' child, for b-bones */
00200     
00201     struct ListBase      iktree;        /* "IK trees" - only while evaluating pose */
00202     struct ListBase     siktree;        /* Spline-IK "trees" - only while evaluating pose */
00203     
00204     bMotionPath *mpath;             /* motion path cache for this bone */
00205     struct Object *custom;          /* draws custom object instead of default bone shape */
00206     struct bPoseChannel *custom_tx; /* odd feature, display with another bones transform.
00207                                      * needed in rare cases for advanced rigs,
00208                                      * since the alternative is highly complicated - campbell */
00209 
00210         /* transforms - written in by actions or transform */
00211     float       loc[3];             
00212     float       size[3];
00213     
00214         /* rotations - written in by actions or transform (but only one representation gets used at any time) */
00215     float       eul[3];                 /* euler rotation */
00216     float       quat[4];                /* quaternion rotation */
00217     float       rotAxis[3], rotAngle;   /* axis-angle rotation */
00218     short       rotmode;                /* eRotationModes - rotation representation to use */
00219     short       pad;
00220     
00221     float       chan_mat[4][4];     /* matrix result of loc/quat/size , and where we put deform in, see next line */
00222     float       pose_mat[4][4];     /* constraints accumulate here. in the end, pose_mat = bone->arm_mat * chan_mat
00223                                      * this matrix is object space */
00224     float       constinv[4][4];     /* inverse result of constraints.
00225                                      * doesn't include effect of restposition, parent, and local transform*/
00226     
00227     float       pose_head[3];       /* actually pose_mat[3] */
00228     float       pose_tail[3];       /* also used for drawing help lines... */
00229     
00230     float       limitmin[3], limitmax[3];   /* DOF constraint, note! - these are stored in degrees, not radians */
00231     float       stiffness[3];               /* DOF stiffness */
00232     float       ikstretch;
00233     float       ikrotweight;        /* weight of joint rotation constraint */
00234     float       iklinweight;        /* weight of joint stretch constraint */
00235 
00236     void        *temp;              /* use for outliner */
00237 } bPoseChannel;
00238 
00239 
00240 /* PoseChannel (transform) flags */
00241 typedef enum ePchan_Flag {
00242         /* has transforms */
00243     POSE_LOC        =   (1<<0),
00244     POSE_ROT        =   (1<<1),
00245     POSE_SIZE       =   (1<<2),
00246         /* old IK/cache stuff... */
00247     POSE_IK_MAT     =   (1<<3),
00248     POSE_UNUSED2    =   (1<<4),
00249     POSE_UNUSED3    =   (1<<5),
00250     POSE_UNUSED4    =   (1<<6),
00251     POSE_UNUSED5    =   (1<<7),
00252         /* has Standard IK */
00253     POSE_HAS_IK     =   (1<<8),
00254         /* IK/Pose solving*/
00255     POSE_CHAIN      =   (1<<9),
00256     POSE_DONE       =   (1<<10),
00257         /* visualisation */
00258     POSE_KEY        =   (1<<11),
00259     POSE_STRIDE     =   (1<<12),
00260         /* standard IK solving */
00261     POSE_IKTREE     =   (1<<13),
00262         /* has Spline IK */
00263     POSE_HAS_IKS    =   (1<<14),
00264         /* spline IK solving */
00265     POSE_IKSPLINE   =   (1<<15)
00266 } ePchan_Flag;
00267 
00268 /* PoseChannel constflag (constraint detection) */
00269 typedef enum ePchan_ConstFlag {
00270     PCHAN_HAS_IK        = (1<<0),
00271     PCHAN_HAS_CONST     = (1<<1),
00272         /* only used for drawing Posemode, not stored in channel */
00273     PCHAN_HAS_ACTION    = (1<<2),
00274     PCHAN_HAS_TARGET    = (1<<3),
00275         /* only for drawing Posemode too */
00276     PCHAN_HAS_STRIDE    = (1<<4),
00277         /* spline IK */
00278     PCHAN_HAS_SPLINEIK  = (1<<5)
00279 } ePchan_ConstFlag;
00280 
00281 /* PoseChannel->ikflag */
00282 typedef enum ePchan_IkFlag {
00283     BONE_IK_NO_XDOF = (1<<0),
00284     BONE_IK_NO_YDOF = (1<<1),
00285     BONE_IK_NO_ZDOF = (1<<2),
00286 
00287     BONE_IK_XLIMIT  = (1<<3),
00288     BONE_IK_YLIMIT  = (1<<4),
00289     BONE_IK_ZLIMIT  = (1<<5),
00290     
00291     BONE_IK_ROTCTL  = (1<<6),
00292     BONE_IK_LINCTL  = (1<<7),
00293 
00294     BONE_IK_NO_XDOF_TEMP = (1<<10),
00295     BONE_IK_NO_YDOF_TEMP = (1<<11),
00296     BONE_IK_NO_ZDOF_TEMP = (1<<12)
00297 } ePchan_IkFlag;
00298 
00299 /* PoseChannel->rotmode and Object->rotmode */
00300 typedef enum eRotationModes {
00301         /* quaternion rotations (default, and for older Blender versions) */
00302     ROT_MODE_QUAT   = 0,
00303         /* euler rotations - keep in sync with enum in BLI_math.h */
00304     ROT_MODE_EUL = 1,       /* Blender 'default' (classic) - must be as 1 to sync with BLI_math_rotation.h defines */
00305     ROT_MODE_XYZ = 1,
00306     ROT_MODE_XZY,
00307     ROT_MODE_YXZ,
00308     ROT_MODE_YZX,
00309     ROT_MODE_ZXY,
00310     ROT_MODE_ZYX,
00311     /* NOTE: space is reserved here for 18 other possible 
00312      * euler rotation orders not implemented 
00313      */
00314         /* axis angle rotations */
00315     ROT_MODE_AXISANGLE = -1,
00316 
00317     ROT_MODE_MIN = ROT_MODE_AXISANGLE,  /* sentinel for Py API */
00318     ROT_MODE_MAX = ROT_MODE_ZYX
00319 } eRotationModes;

00321 /* Pose ------------------------------------ */
00322 
00323 /* Pose-Object. 
00324  *
00325  * It is only found under ob->pose. It is not library data, even
00326  * though there is a define for it (hack for the outliner).
00327  */
00328 typedef struct bPose {
00329     ListBase chanbase;          /* list of pose channels, PoseBones in RNA */
00330     struct GHash *chanhash;     /* ghash for quicker string lookups */
00331     
00332     short flag, pad;
00333     unsigned int proxy_layer;   /* proxy layer: copy from armature, gets synced */
00334     int pad1;
00335     
00336     float ctime;                /* local action time of this pose */
00337     float stride_offset[3];     /* applied to object */
00338     float cyclic_offset[3];     /* result of match and cycles, applied in where_is_pose() */
00339     
00340     
00341     ListBase agroups;           /* list of bActionGroups */
00342     
00343     int active_group;           /* index of active group (starts from 1) */
00344     int iksolver;               /* ik solver to use, see ePose_IKSolverType */
00345     void *ikdata;               /* temporary IK data, depends on the IK solver. Not saved in file */
00346     void *ikparam;              /* IK solver parameters, structure depends on iksolver */ 
00347     
00348     bAnimVizSettings avs;       /* settings for visualization of bone animation */
00349     char proxy_act_bone[64];    /* proxy active bone name, MAXBONENAME */
00350 } bPose;
00351 
00352 
00353 /* Pose->flag */
00354 typedef enum ePose_Flags {
00355         /* results in armature_rebuild_pose being called */
00356     POSE_RECALC = (1<<0),
00357         /* prevents any channel from getting overridden by anim from IPO */
00358     POSE_LOCKED = (1<<1),
00359         /* clears the POSE_LOCKED flag for the next time the pose is evaluated */
00360     POSE_DO_UNLOCK  = (1<<2),
00361         /* pose has constraints which depend on time (used when depsgraph updates for a new frame) */
00362     POSE_CONSTRAINTS_TIMEDEPEND = (1<<3),
00363         /* recalculate bone paths */
00364     POSE_RECALCPATHS = (1<<4),
00365         /* set by armature_rebuild_pose to give a chance to the IK solver to rebuild IK tree */
00366     POSE_WAS_REBUILT = (1<<5),
00367         /* set by game_copy_pose to indicate that this pose is used in the game engine */
00368     POSE_GAME_ENGINE = (1<<6)
00369 } ePose_Flags;
00370

00374 typedef enum ePose_IKSolverType {
00375     IKSOLVER_LEGACY = 0,
00376     IKSOLVER_ITASC

00379 /* header for all bPose->ikparam structures */
00380 typedef struct bIKParam {

00384 /* bPose->ikparam when bPose->iksolver=1 */
00385 typedef struct bItasc {
00386     int   iksolver;
00387     float precision;
00388     short numiter;
00389     short numstep;
00390     float minstep;
00391     float maxstep;
00392     short solver;   
00393     short flag;
00394     float feedback;
00395     float maxvel;   /* max velocity to SDLS solver */
00396     float dampmax;  /* maximum damping for DLS solver */
00397     float dampeps;  /* threshold of singular value from which the damping start progressively */
00398 } bItasc;
00399 
00400 /* bItasc->flag */
00401 typedef enum eItasc_Flags {
00402     ITASC_AUTO_STEP = (1<<0),
00403     ITASC_INITIAL_REITERATION = (1<<1),
00404     ITASC_REITERATION = (1<<2),
00405     ITASC_SIMULATION = (1<<3)
00406 } eItasc_Flags;
00407 
00408 /* bItasc->solver */
00409 typedef enum eItasc_Solver {
00410     ITASC_SOLVER_SDLS = 0,  /* selective damped least square, suitable for CopyPose constraint */
00411     ITASC_SOLVER_DLS        /* damped least square with numerical filtering of damping */
00412 } eItasc_Solver;

00417 /* Groups -------------------------------------- */
00418 
00419 /* Action-Channel Group (agrp)
00420  *
00421  * These are stored as a list per-Action, and are only used to 
00422  * group that Action's channels in an Animation Editor. 
00423  *
00424  * Even though all FCurves live in a big list per Action, each group they are in also
00425  * holds references to the achans within that list which belong to it. Care must be taken to
00426  * ensure that action-groups never end up being the sole 'owner' of a channel.
00427  * 
00428  * This is also exploited for bone-groups. Bone-Groups are stored per bPose, and are used 
00429  * primarily to color bones in the 3d-view. There are other benefits too, but those are mostly related
00430  * to Action-Groups.
00431  *
00432  * Note that these two uses each have their own RNA 'ActionGroup' and 'BoneGroup'.
00433  */
00434 typedef struct bActionGroup {
00435     struct bActionGroup *next, *prev;
00436     
00437     ListBase channels;          /* Note: this must not be touched by standard listbase functions which would clear links to other channels */
00438     
00439     int flag;                   /* settings for this action-group */
00440     int customCol;              /* index of custom color set to use when used for bones (0=default - used for all old files, -1=custom set) */              
00441     char name[64];              /* name of the group */
00442     
00443     ThemeWireColor cs;          /* color set to use when customCol == -1 */
00444 } bActionGroup;
00445 
00446 /* Action Group flags */
00447 typedef enum eActionGroup_Flag {
00448         /* group is selected */
00449     AGRP_SELECTED   = (1<<0),
00450         /* group is 'active' / last selected one */
00451     AGRP_ACTIVE     = (1<<1),
00452         /* keyframes/channels belonging to it cannot be edited */
00453     AGRP_PROTECTED  = (1<<2),
00454         /* for UI (DopeSheet), sub-channels are shown */
00455     AGRP_EXPANDED   = (1<<3),
00456         /* sub-channels are not evaluated */
00457     AGRP_MUTED      = (1<<4),
00458         /* sub-channels are not visible in Graph Editor */
00459     AGRP_NOTVISIBLE = (1<<5),
00460         /* for UI (Graph Editor), sub-channels are shown */
00461     AGRP_EXPANDED_G = (1<<6),
00462     
00463     AGRP_TEMP       = (1<<30),
00464     AGRP_MOVED      = (1<<31)
00465 } eActionGroup_Flag;
00466 
00467 
00468 /* Actions -------------------------------------- */
00469 
00470 /* Action - reusable F-Curve 'bag'  (act) 
00471  *
00472  * This contains F-Curves that may affect settings from more than one ID blocktype and/or 
00473  * datablock (i.e. sub-data linked/used directly to the ID block that the animation data is linked to), 
00474  * but with the restriction that the other unrelated data (i.e. data that is not directly used or linked to
00475  * by the source ID block).
00476  *
00477  * It serves as a 'unit' of reusable animation information (i.e. keyframes/motion data), that 
00478  * affects a group of related settings (as defined by the user). 
00479  */
00480 typedef struct bAction {
00481     ID  id;             /* ID-serialisation for relinking */
00482     
00483     ListBase curves;    /* function-curves (FCurve) */
00484     ListBase chanbase;  /* legacy data - Action Channels (bActionChannel) in pre-2.5 animation system */
00485     ListBase groups;    /* groups of function-curves (bActionGroup) */
00486     ListBase markers;   /* markers local to the Action (used to provide Pose-Libraries) */
00487     
00488     int flag;           /* settings for this action */
00489     int active_marker;  /* index of the active marker */
00490     
00491     int idroot;         /* type of ID-blocks that action can be assigned to (if 0, will be set to whatever ID first evaluates it) */
00492     int pad;
00493 } bAction;
00494 
00495 
00496 /* Flags for the action */
00497 typedef enum eAction_Flags {
00498         /* flags for displaying in UI */
00499     ACT_COLLAPSED   = (1<<0),
00500     ACT_SELECTED    = (1<<1),
00501     
00502         /* flags for evaluation/editing */
00503     ACT_MUTED       = (1<<9),
00504     ACT_PROTECTED   = (1<<10),
00505     ACT_DISABLED    = (1<<11)
00506 } eAction_Flags;
00507 
00508

00510 /* Action/Dopesheet Editor */
00511 
00512 /* Storage for Dopesheet/Grease-Pencil Editor data */
00513 typedef struct bDopeSheet {
00514     ID      *source;            /* currently ID_SCE (for Dopesheet), and ID_SC (for Grease Pencil) */
00515     ListBase chanbase;          /* cache for channels (only initialized when pinned) */  // XXX not used!
00516     
00517     struct Group *filter_grp;   /* object group for ADS_FILTER_ONLYOBGROUP filtering option */
00518     char searchstr[64];         /* string to search for in displayed names of F-Curves for ADS_FILTER_BY_FCU_NAME filtering option */
00519     
00520     int filterflag;             /* flags to use for filtering data */
00521     int flag;                   /* standard flags */
00522     
00523     int renameIndex;            /* index+1 of channel to rename - only gets set by renaming operator */
00524     int pad;
00525 } bDopeSheet;
00526 
00527 
00528 /* DopeSheet filter-flag */
00529 typedef enum eDopeSheet_FilterFlag {
00530         /* general filtering */
00531     ADS_FILTER_ONLYSEL          = (1<<0),   /* only include channels relating to selected data */
00532     
00533         /* temporary filters */
00534     ADS_FILTER_ONLYDRIVERS      = (1<<1),   /* for 'Drivers' editor - only include Driver data from AnimData */
00535     ADS_FILTER_ONLYNLA          = (1<<2),   /* for 'NLA' editor - only include NLA data from AnimData */
00536     ADS_FILTER_SELEDIT          = (1<<3),   /* for Graph Editor - used to indicate whether to include a filtering flag or not */
00537     
00538         /* general filtering 2 */
00539     ADS_FILTER_SUMMARY          = (1<<4),   /* for 'DopeSheet' Editors - include 'summary' line */
00540     ADS_FILTER_ONLYOBGROUP      = (1<<5),   /* only the objects in the specified object group get used */
00541     
00542         /* datatype-based filtering */
00543     ADS_FILTER_NOSHAPEKEYS      = (1<<6),
00544     ADS_FILTER_NOMESH           = (1<<7),
00545     ADS_FILTER_NOOBJ            = (1<<8),   /* for animdata on object level, if we only want to concentrate on materials/etc. */
00546     ADS_FILTER_NOLAT            = (1<<9),
00547     ADS_FILTER_NOCAM            = (1<<10),
00548     ADS_FILTER_NOMAT            = (1<<11),
00549     ADS_FILTER_NOLAM            = (1<<12),
00550     ADS_FILTER_NOCUR            = (1<<13),
00551     ADS_FILTER_NOWOR            = (1<<14),
00552     ADS_FILTER_NOSCE            = (1<<15),
00553     ADS_FILTER_NOPART           = (1<<16),
00554     ADS_FILTER_NOMBA            = (1<<17),
00555     ADS_FILTER_NOARM            = (1<<18),
00556     ADS_FILTER_NONTREE          = (1<<19),
00557     ADS_FILTER_NOTEX            = (1<<20),
00558     ADS_FILTER_NOSPK            = (1<<21),
00559     
00560         /* NLA-specific filters */
00561     ADS_FILTER_NLA_NOACT        = (1<<25),  /* if the AnimData block has no NLA data, don't include to just show Action-line */
00562     
00563         /* general filtering 3 */
00564     ADS_FILTER_INCL_HIDDEN      = (1<<26),  /* include 'hidden' channels too (i.e. those from hidden Objects/Bones) */
00565     ADS_FILTER_BY_FCU_NAME      = (1<<27),  /* for F-Curves, filter by the displayed name (i.e. to isolate all Location curves only) */
00566     
00567         /* combination filters (some only used at runtime) */
00568     ADS_FILTER_NOOBDATA = (ADS_FILTER_NOCAM|ADS_FILTER_NOMAT|ADS_FILTER_NOLAM|ADS_FILTER_NOCUR|ADS_FILTER_NOPART|ADS_FILTER_NOARM|ADS_FILTER_NOSPK)
00569 } eDopeSheet_FilterFlag;    
00570 
00571 /* DopeSheet general flags */
00572 typedef enum eDopeSheet_Flag {
00573     ADS_FLAG_SUMMARY_COLLAPSED  = (1<<0),   /* when summary is shown, it is collapsed, so all other channels get hidden */
00574     ADS_FLAG_SHOW_DBFILTERS     = (1<<1)    /* show filters for datablocks */
00575 } eDopeSheet_Flag;

00579 /* Action Editor Space. This is defined here instead of in DNA_space_types.h */
00580 typedef struct SpaceAction {
00581     struct SpaceLink *next, *prev;
00582     ListBase regionbase;        /* storage of regions for inactive spaces */
00583     int spacetype;
00584     float blockscale;
00585 
00586     short blockhandler[8];
00587 
00588     View2D v2d  DNA_DEPRECATED; /* copied to region */
00589     
00590     bAction     *action;        /* the currently active action */
00591     bDopeSheet  ads;            /* the currently active context (when not showing action) */
00592     
00593     char  mode, autosnap;       /* mode: editing context; autosnap: automatic keyframe snapping mode   */
00594     short flag;                 /* flag: bitmapped settings; */
00595     float timeslide;            /* for Time-Slide transform mode drawing - current frame? */
00596 } SpaceAction;
00597 
00598 /* SpaceAction flag */
00599 typedef enum eSAction_Flag {
00600         /* during transform (only set for TimeSlide) */
00601     SACTION_MOVING  = (1<<0),   
00602         /* show sliders */
00603     SACTION_SLIDERS = (1<<1),   
00604         /* draw time in seconds instead of time in frames */
00605     SACTION_DRAWTIME = (1<<2),
00606         /* don't filter action channels according to visibility */
00607     //SACTION_NOHIDE = (1<<3), // XXX depreceated... old animation system
00608         /* don't kill overlapping keyframes after transform */
00609     SACTION_NOTRANSKEYCULL = (1<<4),
00610         /* don't include keyframes that are out of view */
00611     //SACTION_HORIZOPTIMISEON = (1<<5), // XXX depreceated... old irrelevant trick
00612         /* show pose-markers (local to action) in Action Editor mode  */
00613     SACTION_POSEMARKERS_SHOW = (1<<6),
00614         /* don't draw action channels using group colors (where applicable) */
00615     SACTION_NODRAWGCOLORS = (1<<7), // XXX depreceated... irrelevant for current groups implementation
00616         /* don't draw current frame number beside frame indicator */
00617     SACTION_NODRAWCFRANUM = (1<<8),
00618         /* temporary flag to force channel selections to be synced with main */
00619     SACTION_TEMP_NEEDCHANSYNC = (1<<9),
00620         /* don't perform realtime updates */
00621     SACTION_NOREALTIMEUPDATES = (1<<10),
00622         /* move markers as well as keyframes */
00623     SACTION_MARKERS_MOVE = (1<<11)
00624 } eSAction_Flag;

00628         /* action on the active object */
00629     SACTCONT_ACTION = 0,
00630         /* list of all shapekeys on the active object, linked with their F-Curves */
00631     SACTCONT_SHAPEKEY,
00632         /* editing of gpencil data */
00633     SACTCONT_GPENCIL,
00634         /* dopesheet (default) */
00635     SACTCONT_DOPESHEET

00638 /* SpaceAction AutoSnap Settings (also used by other Animation Editors) */
00639 typedef enum eAnimEdit_AutoSnap {
00640         /* no auto-snap */
00641     SACTSNAP_OFF = 0,   
00642         /* snap to 1.0 frame/second intervals */
00643     SACTSNAP_STEP,
00644         /* snap to actual frames/seconds (nla-action time) */
00645     SACTSNAP_FRAME,
00646         /* snap to nearest marker */
00647     SACTSNAP_MARKER
00648 } eAnimEdit_AutoSnap;

00651 /* ************************************************ */
00652 /* Legacy Data */
00653 
00654 /* WARNING: Action Channels are now depreceated... they were part of the old animation system!
00655  *        (ONLY USED FOR DO_VERSIONS...)
00656  * 
00657  * Action Channels belong to Actions. They are linked with an IPO block, and can also own 
00658  * Constraint Channels in certain situations. 
00659  *
00660  * Action-Channels can only belong to one group at a time, but they still live the Action's
00661  * list of achans (to preserve backwards compatibility, and also minimize the code
00662  * that would need to be recoded). Grouped achans are stored at the start of the list, according
00663  * to the position of the group in the list, and their position within the group. 
00664  */
00665 typedef struct bActionChannel {
00666     struct bActionChannel   *next, *prev;
00667     bActionGroup            *grp;                   /* Action Group this Action Channel belongs to */
00668     
00669     struct Ipo              *ipo;                   /* IPO block this action channel references */
00670     ListBase                constraintChannels;     /* Constraint Channels (when Action Channel represents an Object or Bone) */
00671     
00672     int     flag;           /* settings accessed via bitmapping */
00673     char    name[64];       /* channel name, MAX_NAME */
00674     int     temp;           /* temporary setting - may be used to indicate group that channel belongs to during syncing  */
00675 } bActionChannel;
00676 
00677 /* Action Channel flags (ONLY USED FOR DO_VERSIONS...) */
00678 typedef enum ACHAN_FLAG {
00679     ACHAN_SELECTED  = (1<<0),
00680     ACHAN_HILIGHTED = (1<<1),
00681     ACHAN_HIDDEN    = (1<<2),
00682     ACHAN_PROTECTED = (1<<3),
00683     ACHAN_EXPANDED  = (1<<4),
00684     ACHAN_SHOWIPO   = (1<<5),
00685     ACHAN_SHOWCONS  = (1<<6),
00686     ACHAN_MOVED     = (1<<31)
00687 } ACHAN_FLAG;
